description:
From Bugzilla Helper:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; WinNT4.0; en-US; rv:0.9.3) Gecko/20010801
BuildID:    2001080110

I have a bookmark pointing to "file://///HOST/share/file.txt".  When HOST is not
responding (either because it is shut off or I have not authenticated to it
yet), trying to view the bookmarks submenu containing the bookmark hangs mozilla
for ~10 seconds.

Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Get two Windows NT boxes, A and B.
2. Make sure they are in the same "workgroup".
3. Export a directory from A as "share" so that it can be accessed from B.
4. Create a text file "file.txt" in the shared directory.
5. Verify that you can access "file.txt" using Mozilla on B.
6. On B, add a bookmark for "file.txt".  Verify that it works.
7. Shut down both machines, start B and try to open the bookmark menu.

Actual Results:  Mozilla hangs for maybe ten seconds, then shows the bookmark
menu as it should.

Expected Results:  Mozilla should have displayed the bookmark menu directly.
summary: Non-responding Windows UNC share hangs bookmark menu
